description: The UK government has confirmed plans to raise social housing rents by more than inflation and slash right-to-buy discounts for council tenants as part of its push to deliver 1.5 million new homes by 2030.
title: Labour Plans Above Inflation Rent Rises for UK Social Tenants

description: The UK plans to step up its naval activity in the Pacific, including more joint fishing patrols, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer seeks to show support for US-led efforts to check China’s expanding maritime reach.
title: UK to Expand Pacific Fishing Patrols in Pushback Against China

description: Georgia holds parliamentary elections on Saturday that pit the ruling party against opponents who say the government is drawing closer to Russia and jeopardizing the country’s chances of joining the European Union and NATO.
title: Georgia Votes in Divisive Election With European Future at Stake

description: The Canadian government warned Friday that “a sophisticated state-sponsored threat actor from the People’s Republic of China” has been scanning the cyber defenses of important public entities.
title: China Is Scanning Canada’s Cyber Defenses, State Watchdog Warns

description: A federal appeals court ruled that Mississippi’s acceptance of mail ballots after Election Day violates US law, but sent the question about whether its decision will apply to the Nov. 5 presidential contest back to a lower court judge.
title: Late Mail Ballots in Mississippi Ruled Illegal in GOP Challenge

description: Group of Seven nations finalized a $50 billion loan to Ukraine backed by the profits generated by immobilized Russian central bank assets, clearing the way for much-needed aid to soon flow to Kyiv and largely shielding critical financing from the outcome of the US presidential election.
title: G-7 Finalizes $50 Billion Ukraine Loan Backed by Russian Assets

description: India’s central bank Governor Shaktikanta Das rejected the proposal of a top government adviser to strip volatile food prices from inflation targets, saying such a move would make no sense to normal consumers.
title: RBI Chief Pushes Back on Calls to Cut Food From Inflation Target

description: The top United Nations human rights official said Israel is committing what may amount to crimes against humanity in the northern Gaza Strip, while Jordan’s top diplomat called the Israeli actions there “ethnic cleansing.”
title: UN, Jordan Warn of Israeli War Crimes, Ethnic Cleansing in Gaza

description: Peru’s government is increasingly worried that recent anti-crime protests may extend through next month and disrupt a summit of world leaders from the Asia-Pacific region.
title: Peru Is Worried APEC Summit May Be Disrupted by Anti-Crime Protests

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Harris Closing Out Campaign’s Final Days Focused on Trump

description: The US government said Friday it was investigating unauthorized access by Chinese state-affiliated hackers targeting the commercial telecommunications sector.
title: US Investigating Breach of Telecoms by China-Linked Hackers

description: The world’s top financial stability watchdog has extended the term of chair Klaas Knot until the end of June, postponing the race to appoint a successor to tackle one of the toughest jobs in global finance.
title: Financial Stability Board Delays Race for Its Next Chief to June

description: Two of the seven swing states likely to determine the outcome of the US presidential election saw their economies contract in the three months through September, based on a gauge from Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia.
title: GDP Shrank in Swing States Michigan, Nevada in Run-Up to Election

description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy told Ukraine’s cabinet to allocate government funding for every Ukrainian to receive 1,000 hryvnia ($24.20) by Dec. 1, to be spent on domestically-produced goods or services.
title: Zelenskiy Offers Special Payment for Ukrainians to Spend at Home

description: Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem said that while the federal government’s decision to trim immigration targets would have a modest effect on growth, the impact on inflation is likely limited.
title: Macklem Sees Little Inflation Impact From Immigration Reform

description: President Joe Biden apologized for the federal government’s role in running a system of Indian boarding schools that separated Native American children from their families and wreaked havoc on tribal communities.
title: Biden Issues Rare Presidential Apology Over Indian Boarding Schools

description: The European Union’s top economic official said that envisioned tariffs by the bloc on Chinese-made electric vehicles can’t be considered protectionism.
title: Don’t Call EU Tariffs on China EVs Protectionism, Gentiloni Says

description: Mali’s military government has threatened to take back Barrick Gold Corp.’s Loulo mine concession when the current permit expires in 2026, amid an escalating dispute over how to divide the economic benefits from operations in the country.
title: Mali Threatens to Let Barrick Mine Permit Lapse Over Dispute

description: Antonio Guterres may have reason to regret that awkward handshake with a smiling Vladimir Putin and the hug with Belarus leader Alexander Lukashenko, or indeed the decision to attend the BRICS summit on Russian soil. Ukrainians are furious and have rescinded an invitation to visit.
title: Ukraine Slams UN Chief After Putin Handshake and Belarus Hug

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams accused prosecutors of leaking information to pressure witnesses as he again sought to dismiss one of the federal bribery charges against him.
title: NYC Mayor Blasts Leaks as He Seeks Dismissal of Bribery Charge

description: The Washington Post won’t be making a presidential endorsement for the 2024 election or in any future presidential races.
title: Washington Post Will No Longer Endorse Presidential Candidates

description: Citigroup Inc. says it time to take profits on some trades tied to a potential win by former President Donald Trump in next month’s election.
title: Citigroup Takes Profits on Some Trump Trades as Investors Favor Republican Candidate

description: Mexico’s Senate voted to prohibit courts from challenging or suspending constitutional changes approved by Congress, an attempt to shield a battery of reforms from Supreme Court scrutiny as it reviews a controversial overhaul of the country’s judiciary.
title: Mexico Senate Votes to Shield Judicial Reform From Top Court Scrutiny

description: The US has signaled to Saudi Arabia it’s ready to help defend the kingdom against an attack by Iran or its proxies, as Gulf states grow increasingly wary of being embroiled in the standoff between the Islamic Republic and Israel, people familiar with the matter said.
title: US Offers Defensive Assurances to Saudi Arabia If Iran Attacks

description: France and Germany are raising concerns about a proposal by the European Union’s diplomatic arm aimed at circumventing Hungary’s veto that is blocking more than €6 billion ($6.6 billion) in aid for Ukraine.
title: Germany, France Balk at EU Plan to Get Past Orban’s Ukraine Veto

description: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris are breaking off from the swing-state trail to campaign in an unlikely venue this close to Election Day — Texas, a state that is solidly in the Republican presidential column.
title: Harris Joined By Beyoncé; Trump With Rogan in Rival Texas Trips

description: A federal judge in Virginia halted what she concluded was an unlawful, systematic purge of names from the state’s voter rolls ahead of the Nov. 5 presidential election, in a win for the Biden administration.
title: Virginia Voter Purge Blocked by US Judge Ahead of Election

description: A political ally of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is calling for the conditional release of Abdullah Ocalan, the leader of the separatist Kurdistan Workers’ Party who has spent almost 25 years behind bars.
title: Why Release of PKK Leader Is Under Discussion in Turkey

description: Far-right lawmaker Geert Wilders’ Freedom Party and his coalition partners have hammered out a deal that sets the Netherlands on course for a strict migration policy.
title: Dutch Tighten Migration Rules With Border Controls From November

description: Turkey said a deadly attack on the country’s main aerospace company this week was aimed at destabilizing an effort to develop a self-sufficient defense industry and strengthen its position in the region.
title: Turkey Says Aerospace Attack a Threat to Bold Defense Ambitions

description: Judicial reforms and the US election are roiling expectations of foreign investment-fueled growth.
title: For Mexico’s Sheinbaum, the Race Is On to Harness Nearshoring

description: President Vladimir Putin said Russia is open to a “reasonable compromise” but won’t make any concessions to end its war in Ukraine.
title: Putin Says Russia Won’t Make Concessions to End War on Ukraine

description: A second batch of North Korean troops will head to Russia soon, according to South Korean intelligence documents shared with allies and seen by Bloomberg News.
title: North Korea to Send More Troops to Russia, South Korea Spies Say

description: Donald Trump is sending mixed messages, but data shows Republicans are voting early in key swing states.
title: Republicans’ Early Voting Surge: What We Know From Ballots So Far

description: Chile’s local elections will be a test of strength between the traditional right-wing coalition and an ultra-conservative party that surged onto the national stage over the last five years.
title: Ultra Conservatives Test Their Strength in Chile Local Elections

description: Lebanon’s economy minister said the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah has already cost his country $20 billion, a figure he expects to keep rising.
title: Lebanon Says More Than Fifth of Population Displaced From Israel-Hezbollah Conflict

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Hopes Fade for Middle East Deal Before US Election

description: Foreign exchange markets are positioning for further sterling weakness ahead of the UK budget on Wednesday, with both hedge funds and asset managers continuing to sell the currency, according to Citigroup Inc.
title: Citi Says Hedge Funds Are Selling the Pound Ahead of UK Budget

description: On a pitch-black Thursday evening at the center of one of the world’s riskiest geopolitical flash points, an array of Taiwanese tanks, armored vehicles, and troops are spread out across a breach, practicing for a scenario they hope never happens.
title: Sights, Sounds of a Taiwan Military Drill Seeking to Deter China

description: The US election next month will be a clash of visions that reverberates through the global economy for years to come.
title: Here Are 5 Industries With the Most at Stake in Presidential Election

description: Taiwan’s top court ruled that key legal changes expanding the powers of legislators were unconstitutional, a decision that will likely make it easier for President Lai Ching-te to govern the archipelago at the center of China-US tensions.
title: Taiwan’s Top Court Rejects Key Laws Expanding Legislative Powers

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz called for further diversification of the nation’s trade as he looks to reduce the economy’s dependence on China in favor of India.
title: Scholz Pledges Stronger Trade With India to Curb China Dominance

description: China and India are pulling back troops from the two remaining friction points along the disputed Himalayan border, days after the leaders of the two countries met.
title: China, India Start Removing Troops from Border Friction Points

description: The European Union still has “significant remaining gaps” with Beijing after eight rounds of negotiations aimed at avoiding tariffs on Chinese-made electric vehicles that are due to kick in by the end of this month, according to a statement from the bloc.
title: Significant Gaps Remain Between EU and China as EV Tariffs Loom

description: Indonesia has started the process of becoming part of the BRICS in a sign of growing influence for the group that’s positioned itself as an alternative to the US-led global order.
title: Indonesia Joins Growing List of Nations Keen to Be Part of BRICS

description: Chemnitz has been at the forefront of Germany’s economic and political problems. As European Capital of Culture 2025, it wants to be part of the solution.
title: Germany’s European Capital of Culture Tackles a Turbulent Past

description: Alcohol-fueled company events could become a thing of the past, as UK employers consider new rules that place an onus on firms to protect workers from sexual harassment or risk hefty damages claims.
title: Boozy Work Parties May Be Over With New UK Harassment Law

description: The Bank of Russia is poised to hike its key interest rate on Friday to the record level it imposed after President Vladimir Putin ordered the invasion of Ukraine, as policymakers struggle to contain rapid price growth.
title: Russia Set to Return Key Rate to Level Seen in Wake of Invasion

description: Switzerland’s efforts to forge closer links with the European Union are going to prove a hard sell with voters, according to a new poll showing that about half are skeptical about the bloc.
title: Swiss Like the EU’s Economic Benefits, Not So Much the EU Itself

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he was willing to have discussions with other Commonwealth countries about Britain’s historic slave trade but won’t provide reparations, amid expectation that the summit could agree to reference reparations justice in a joint communique this week.
title: Starmer Says He’s Open to Talks on UK’s Historic Slave Trade

description: Elon Musk gave another $56 million to elect Donald Trump and other Republicans in the final weeks of the 2024 election, bringing to at least $132 million the amount spent by the world’s richest person to elevate his allies to the White House and Congress, federal filings show.
title: Musk Gives at Least $132 Million to Elect Trump, GOP Allies

description: The US State Department has issued a warning over protests planned for Friday at Israeli and US embassies and other sites around the world.
title: State Department Issues Warning Over Gaza ‘Rage’ Protests Friday

description: President Xi Jinping’s boldest economic stimulus since the pandemic failed to impress global luminaries gathered in Washington this week, who called for more measures to rebalance China’s growth and greater clarity over Beijing’s policy plans.
title: Xi’s Stimulus Package Met With Wall of Skepticism in Washington

description: South Korea expects to continue its strong ties with the US regardless of the election outcome next month, the country’s finance minister, Choi Sang-mok, said Thursday.
title: South Korea Vows to Keep Investing in US ‘Whoever Wins’ Election

description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba may need the support of disgraced lawmakers at the center of a slush-fund scandal to shore up his administration after a snap election he called to help move on from the incident.
title: Japan’s Ishiba May Need Scandal-Hit Lawmakers to Shore Up Power
